noun.description: A mythical animal typically represented as a horse with a single straight horn projecting from its forehead.
A start-up company valued at more than a billion dollars, typically in the software or technology sector.
examples: many unicorn start-ups have little revenue to speak of

noun.description: A carriage drawn by three horses, two abreast and one leader.

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin unicornis, from uni- single + cornu horn, translating Greek monokerōs.
